intro: Canthium multiflorum, commonly known as the many-flowered spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with latex-producing properties. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces small, greenish flowers clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Canthium multiflorum is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges.
